026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool;
027
028import java.io.PrintStream;
029import java.io.PrintWriter;
030import java.lang.ref.Reference;
031import java.lang.ref.SoftReference;
032import java.util.EnumSet;
033import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
034import java.util.Locale;
035import java.util.Map;
036import java.util.ResourceBundle;
037import java.util.Set;
038
039import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
040import javax.lang.model.element.Modifier;
041import javax.lang.model.element.NestingKind;
042import javax.tools.Diagnostic;
043import javax.tools.Diagnostic.Kind;
044import javax.tools.FileObject;
045import javax.tools.ForwardingFileObject;
046import javax.tools.JavaFileObject;
047
048import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Reporter;
049
050import com.sun.source.doctree.CommentTree;
051import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
052import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTypeTree;
053import com.sun.source.doctree.ReferenceTree;
054import com.sun.source.doctree.TextTree;
055import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.DCTree.DCDocComment;
056import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.DCTree;
057
058import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.EndPosTable;
059import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Context.Factory;
060import com.sun.tools.javac.util.DiagnosticSource;
061import com.sun.source.tree.CompilationUnitTree;
062import com.sun.source.util.DocSourcePositions;
063import com.sun.source.util.DocTreePath;
064import com.sun.source.util.TreePath;
065import com.sun.tools.javac.tree.JCTree;
066import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Context;
067import com.sun.tools.javac.util.JCDiagnostic;
068import com.sun.tools.javac.util.JCDiagnostic.DiagnosticFlag;
069import com.sun.tools.javac.util.JCDiagnostic.DiagnosticPosition;
070import com.sun.tools.javac.util.JCDiagnostic.DiagnosticType;
071import com.sun.tools.javac.util.JavacMessages;
072import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Log;
073
074/**
075 * Class for reporting diagnostics and other messages.
076 *
077 * The class leverages the javac support for reporting diagnostics, for stylistic consistency
078 * of diagnostic messages and to avoid code duplication.
079 *
080 * The class is a subtype of javac's Log, and is primarily an adapter between
081 * javadoc method signatures and the underlying javac methods. Within this class,
082 * the methods call down to a core {@code report} method which hands off to
083 * a similar method in the superclass ({@code Log.report}, which takes care
084 * of reporting the diagnostic (unless it has been suppressed), displaying
085 * the source line and a caret to indicate the position of the issue (if appropriate),
086 * counting errors and warnings, and so on.
087 *
088 * In general, the underlying javac layer is more powerful, whereas the javadoc methods are
089 * constrained by the public {@link jdk.javadoc.doclet.Doclet} API.
090 *
091 * In the underlying javac layer, the following abstractions are used:
092 * <ul>
093 *     <li>{@code DiagnosticType} -- error, warning, note, etc.
094 *     <li>{@code DiagnosticSource} -- a file object and a cache of its content
095 *     <li>{@code DiagnosticPosition} -- a tuple of values (start, pos, end) for the position of a diagnostic
096 *     <li>{@code DiagnosticFlag} -- additional flags related to the diagnostic
097 * </ul>
098 *
099 * The javadoc layer is defined by the methods on {@code Doclet.Reporter}, and by
100 * assorted methods defined in this class for use by the javadoc tool.
101 * The primary data types are:
102 * <ul>
103 *     <li>{@code Diagnostic.Kind} -- maps to {@code DiagnosticType} and {@code Set<DiagnosticFlag>}
104 *     <li>{@code Element} -- maps to {@code DiagnosticSource} and {@code DiagnosticPosition}
105 *     <li>{@code DocTreePath} -- maps to {@code DiagnosticSource} and {@code DiagnosticPosition}
106 * </ul>
107 *
108 * The reporting methods in the javac layer primarily take pre-localized (key, args) pairs,
109 * while the methods in the javadoc layer, especially the {@code Reporter} interface, take
110 * localized strings. To accommodate this, "wrapper" resources are used, whose value is {@code {0}},
111 * to pass the localized string down to javac. A side-effect is that clients using a
112 * {@code DiagnosticListener} with a {@code DocumentationTask} cannot access the original resource
113 * key for the localized message.
114 * Given the limitations of the API, it is not possible to do any better.
115 * The javac Annotation Processing API has the same problem.
116 *
117 * There is a slight disparity between javac's use of streams and javadoc's use of streams.
118 * javac reports <b>all</b> diagnostics to the "error" stream, and provides a separate
119 * "output" stream for expected output, such as command-line help or the output from options
120 * like {@code -Xprint}. javadoc API, and {@code Reporter} in particular, does not specify
121 * the use of streams, and provides no support for identifying or specifying streams. JDK-8267204.
122 * The current implementation/workaround is to write errors and warnings to the "error"
123 * stream and notes to the "output" stream.
124 *
125 * @see java.util.ResourceBundle
126 * @see java.text.MessageFormat
127 */
128public class JavadocLog extends Log implements Reporter {
129    /** The overall context for the documentation run. */
130    private final Context context;
131
132    /** The tool environment, providing access to the tool's utility classes and tables. */
133    private ToolEnvironment toolEnv;
134
135    /** The utility class to access the positions of items in doc comments. */
136    private DocSourcePositions sourcePositions;
137
138    /**
139     * A memory-sensitive cache of recently used {@code DiagnosticSource} objects.
140     */
141    private final LinkedHashMap<JavaFileObject,
142            SoftReference<DiagnosticSource>> diagSourceCache;
143
144    /** Get the current javadoc log, which is also the compiler log. */
145    public static JavadocLog instance0(Context context) {
146        Log instance = context.get(logKey);
147        if (!(instance instanceof JavadocLog l))
148            throw new InternalError("no JavadocLog instance!");
149        return l;
150    }
151
152    public static void preRegister(Context context,
153            final String programName) {
154        context.put(logKey, (Factory<Log>) c -> new JavadocLog(c, programName));
155    }
156
157    public static void preRegister(Context context, final String programName,
158            final PrintWriter outWriter, final PrintWriter errWriter) {
159        context.put(logKey, (Factory<Log>) c -> new JavadocLog(c, programName,
160            outWriter, errWriter));
161    }
162
163    final String programName;
164
165    private Locale locale;
166    private final JavacMessages messages;
167    private final JCDiagnostic.Factory javadocDiags;
168
169    private static PrintWriter createPrintWriter(PrintStream ps,
170            boolean autoflush) {
171        return new PrintWriter(ps, autoflush) {
172            // avoid closing system streams
173            @Override
174            public void close() {
175                super.flush();
176            }
177        };
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Constructor
182     * @param programName  Name of the program (for error messages).
183     */
184    public JavadocLog(Context context, String programName) {
185        // use the current values of System.out, System.err, in case they have
186        // been redirected
187        this(context, programName,
188            createPrintWriter(System.out, false),
189            createPrintWriter(System.err, true));
190    }
191
192    /**
193     * Constructor
194     * @param programName  Name of the program (for error messages).
195     * @param outWriter    Stream for notices etc.
196     * @param errWriter    Stream for errors and warnings
197     */
198    public JavadocLog(Context context, String programName,
199            PrintWriter outWriter, PrintWriter errWriter) {
200        super(context, outWriter, errWriter);
201        messages = JavacMessages.instance(context);
202        messages.add(locale -> ResourceBundle.getBundle(
203            "org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool.resources.javadoc",
204            locale));
205        javadocDiags = new JCDiagnostic.Factory(messages, "javadoc");
206        this.programName = programName;
207        this.context = context;
208        locale = Locale.getDefault();
209
210        diagSourceCache = new LinkedHashMap<>() {
211            private static final int MAX_ENTRIES = 5;
212
213            @Override
214            protected boolean removeEldestEntry(Map.Entry<JavaFileObject,
215                    SoftReference<DiagnosticSource>> eldest) {
216                return size() > MAX_ENTRIES;
217            }
218        };
219    }
220
221    @Override // Reporter
222    public PrintWriter getStandardWriter() {
223        return getWriter(Log.WriterKind.STDOUT);
224    }
225
226    @Override // Reporter
227    public PrintWriter getDiagnosticWriter() {
228        return getWriter(Log.WriterKind.STDERR);
229    }
230
231    public void setLocale(Locale locale) {
232        this.locale = locale;
233    }
234
235    /**
236     * Returns the localized string from the tool's resource bundles.
237     *
238     * @param key the resource key
239     * @param args arguments for the resource
240     */
241    String getText(String key, Object... args) {
242        return messages.getLocalizedString(locale, key, args);
243    }
244
245    @Override // Reporter
246    public void print(Kind kind, String message) {
247        report(kind, null, null, message);
248    }
249
250    @Override // Reporter
251    public void print(Diagnostic.Kind kind, DocTreePath path, String message) {
252        DiagnosticType dt = getDiagnosticType(kind);
253        Set<DiagnosticFlag> flags = getDiagnosticFlags(kind);
254        DiagnosticSource ds = getDiagnosticSource(path);
255        DiagnosticPosition dp = getDiagnosticPosition(path);
256        report(dt, flags, ds, dp, message);
257    }
258
259    @Override // Reporter
260    public void print(Diagnostic.Kind kind, DocTreePath path, int start,
261            int pos, int end, String message) {
262        if (!(start <= pos && pos <= end)) {
263            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
264                "start:" + start + ",pos:" + pos + ",end:" + end);
265        }
266
267        DocTree t = path.getLeaf();
268        String s = switch (t.getKind()) {
269        case COMMENT -> ((CommentTree) t).getBody();
270        case DOC_TYPE -> ((DocTypeTree) t).getText();
271        case REFERENCE -> ((ReferenceTree) t).getSignature();
272        case TEXT -> ((TextTree) t).getBody();
273        default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException(t.getKind().toString());
274        };
275
276        if (start < 0 || end > s.length()) {
277            throw new StringIndexOutOfBoundsException(
278                "start:" + start + ",pos:" + pos + ",end:" + end
279                    + "; string length " + s.length());
280        }
281
282        DiagnosticType dt = getDiagnosticType(kind);
283        Set<DiagnosticFlag> flags = getDiagnosticFlags(kind);
284        DiagnosticSource ds = getDiagnosticSource(path);
285
286        DCTree.DCDocComment docComment
287            = (DCTree.DCDocComment) path.getDocComment();
288        DCTree docTree = (DCTree) path.getLeaf();
289        // note: it is important to evaluate the offsets in the context of the
290        // position
291        // within the comment text, and not in the context of the overall source
292        // text
293        int dtStart = docTree.getStartPosition();
294        int sStart = docComment.getSourcePosition(dtStart + start);
295        int sPos = docComment.getSourcePosition(dtStart + pos);
296        int sEnd = docComment.getSourcePosition(dtStart + end);
297        DiagnosticPosition dp
298            = createDiagnosticPosition(null, sStart, sPos, sEnd);
299
300        report(dt, flags, ds, dp, message);
301    }
302
303    @Override  // Reporter
304    public void print(Kind kind, Element element, String message) {
305        DiagnosticType dt = getDiagnosticType(kind);
306        Set<DiagnosticFlag> flags = getDiagnosticFlags(kind);
307        DiagnosticSource ds = getDiagnosticSource(element);
308        DiagnosticPosition dp = getDiagnosticPosition(element);
309        report(dt, flags, ds, dp, message);
310    }
311
312    @Override // Reporter
313    public void print(Kind kind, FileObject file, int start, int pos, int end,
314            String message) throws IllegalArgumentException {
315        DiagnosticType dt = getDiagnosticType(kind);
316        Set<DiagnosticFlag> flags = getDiagnosticFlags(kind);
317        // Although not required to do so, it is the case that any file object
318        // returned from the
319        // javac impl of JavaFileManager will return an object that implements
320        // JavaFileObject.
321        // See PathFileObject, which provides the primary impls of
322        // (Java)FileObject.
323        JavaFileObject fo = file instanceof JavaFileObject _fo ? _fo
324            : new WrappingJavaFileObject(file);
325        DiagnosticSource ds = new DiagnosticSource(fo, this);
326        DiagnosticPosition dp = createDiagnosticPosition(null, start, pos, end);
327        report(dt, flags, ds, dp, message);
328    }
329
330    private class WrappingJavaFileObject
331            extends ForwardingFileObject<FileObject> implements JavaFileObject {
332
333        WrappingJavaFileObject(FileObject fo) {
334            super(fo);
335            assert !(fo instanceof JavaFileObject);
336        }
337
338        @Override
339        public Kind getKind() {
340            String name = fileObject.getName();
341            return name.endsWith(Kind.HTML.extension)
342                ? JavaFileObject.Kind.HTML
343                : JavaFileObject.Kind.OTHER;
344        }
345
346        @Override
347        public boolean isNameCompatible(String simpleName, Kind kind) {
348            return false;
349        }
350
351        @Override
352        public NestingKind getNestingKind() {
353            return null;
354        }
355
356        @Override
357        public Modifier getAccessLevel() {
358            return null;
359        }
360    }
361
362    /**
363     * Prints an error message.
364     *
365     * @param message the message
366     */
367    public void printError(String message) {
368        report(DiagnosticType.ERROR, null, null, message);
369    }
370
371    /**
372     * Prints an error message for a given documentation tree node.
373     *
374     * @param path    the path for the documentation tree node
375     * @param message the message
376     */
377    public void printError(DocTreePath path, String message) {
378        DiagnosticSource ds = getDiagnosticSource(path);
379        DiagnosticPosition dp = getDiagnosticPosition(path);
380        report(DiagnosticType.ERROR, EnumSet.noneOf(DiagnosticFlag.class), ds,
381            dp, message);
382    }
383
384    /**
385     * Prints an error message for a given element.
386     *
387     * @param element the element
388     * @param message the message
389     */
390    public void printError(Element element, String message) {
391        DiagnosticSource ds = getDiagnosticSource(element);
392        DiagnosticPosition dp = getDiagnosticPosition(element);
393        report(DiagnosticType.ERROR, EnumSet.noneOf(DiagnosticFlag.class), ds,
394            dp, message);
395    }
396
397    /**
398     * Prints an error message.
399     *
400     * @param key the resource key for the message
401     * @param args the arguments for the message
402     */
403    public void printErrorUsingKey(String key, Object... args) {
404        printError(getText(key, args));
405    }
406
407    /**
408     * Prints a warning message.
409     *
410     * @param message the message
411     */
412    public void printWarning(String message) {
413        report(DiagnosticType.WARNING, null, null, message);
414    }
415
416    /**
417     * Prints a warning message for a given documentation tree node.
418     *
419     * @param path    the path for the documentation tree node
420     * @param message the message
421     */
422    public void printWarning(DocTreePath path, String message) {
423        DiagnosticSource ds = getDiagnosticSource(path);
424        DiagnosticPosition dp = getDiagnosticPosition(path);
425        report(DiagnosticType.WARNING, EnumSet.noneOf(DiagnosticFlag.class), ds,
426            dp, message);
427    }
428
429    /**
430     * Prints a warning message for a given element.
431     *
432     * @param element the element
433     * @param message the message
434     */
435    public void printWarning(Element element, String message) {
436        DiagnosticSource ds = getDiagnosticSource(element);
437        DiagnosticPosition dp = getDiagnosticPosition(element);
438        report(DiagnosticType.WARNING, EnumSet.noneOf(DiagnosticFlag.class), ds,
439            dp, message);
440    }
441
442    /**
443     * Prints a warning message.
444     *
445     * @param key the resource key for the message
446     * @param args the arguments for the message
447     */
448    public void printWarningUsingKey(String key, Object... args) {
449        printWarning(getText(key, args));
450    }
451
452    /**
453     * Prints a warning message for an element.
454     *
455     * @param element the element
456     * @param key     the resource key for the message
457     * @param args    the arguments for the message
458     */
459    public void printWarningUsingKey(Element element, String key,
460            Object... args) {
461        printWarning(element, getText(key, args));
462    }
463
464    /**
465     * Prints a "notice" message.
466     *
467     * @param message the message
468     */
469    public void printNote(String message) {
470        // Ideally, for consistency with errors and warnings, we would use the
471        // following:
472        // report(Kind.NOTE, null, null, message);
473        // but the default formatting in Log for Kind.NOTE is to prefix the line
474        // with "Note:"
475        // which is undesirable and inconsistent with existing javadoc output.
476        // For now, to avoid the prefix, we write directly to the underlying
477        // stream.
478        printRawLines(WriterKind.NOTICE, message);
479    }
480
481    /**
482     * Prints a "notice" message.
483     *
484     * @param key the resource key for the message
485     * @param args the arguments for the message
486     */
487    public void printNoteUsingKey(String key, Object... args) {
488        printNote(getText(key, args));
489    }
490
491    /**
492     * Returns true if errors have been recorded.
493     */
494    public boolean hasErrors() {
495        return nerrors != 0;
496    }
497
498    /**
499     * Returns true if warnings have been recorded.
500     */
501    public boolean hasWarnings() {
502        return nwarnings != 0;
503    }
504
505    /**
506     * Prints the error and warning counts, if any, to the diagnostic writer.
507     */
508    public void printErrorWarningCounts() {
509        printCount(nerrors, "main.error", "main.errors");
510        printCount(nwarnings, "main.warning", "main.warnings");
511    }
512
513    private void printCount(int count, String singleKey, String pluralKey) {
514        if (count > 0) {
515            String message = getText(count > 1 ? pluralKey : singleKey, count);
516            if (diagListener != null) {
517                report(DiagnosticType.NOTE, null, null, message);
518            } else {
519                printRawLines(getDiagnosticWriter(), message);
520            }
521        }
522    }
523
524    /**
525     * Reports a diagnostic message.
526     *
527     * @param kind    the kind of diagnostic
528     * @param ds      the diagnostic source
529     * @param dp      the diagnostic position
530     * @param message the message
531     */
532    private void report(Diagnostic.Kind kind, DiagnosticSource ds,
533            DiagnosticPosition dp, String message) {
534        report(getDiagnosticType(kind), getDiagnosticFlags(kind), ds, dp,
535            message);
536    }
537
538    /**
539     * Reports a diagnostic message.
540     *
541     * @param dt      the diagnostic type
542     * @param ds      the diagnostic source
543     * @param dp      the diagnostic position
544     * @param message the message
545     */
546    private void report(DiagnosticType dt, DiagnosticSource ds,
547            DiagnosticPosition dp, String message) {
548        report(dt, EnumSet.noneOf(DiagnosticFlag.class), ds, dp, message);
549    }
550
551    /**
552     * Reports a diagnostic message, with diagnostic flags.
553     * For javadoc, the only flag that is used is {@code MANDATORY_WARNING}, and only
554     * because in principle the public API supports it via {@code Kind.MANDATORY_WARNING}.
555     * javadoc itself does generate mandatory warnings.
556     *
557     * This is the primary low-level wrapper around the underlying {@code Log.report}.
558     * Because we already have a localized message, we use wrapper resources (just {@code {0}})
559     * to wrap the string. The current behavior is one wrapper per diagnostic type.
560     * We could improve this by subtyping {@code DiagnosticInfo} to modify the resource key used.
561     *
562     * {@code Log} reports all diagnostics to the corresponding writer, which defaults
563     * to the "error" stream, when using the two-stream constructor. That doesn't work
564     * for javadoc, which has historically written notes to the "output" stream, because
565     * the public API used by doclets does not provide for more detailed control.
566     * Therefore, for now, javadoc continues to use the (deprecated) three-stream
567     * constructor, with the {@code NOTE} stream set to the "output" stream.
568     *
569     * {@code Log} reports all notes with a "Note:" prefix. That's not good for the
570     * standard doclet, which uses notes to report the various "progress" messages,
571     * such as  "Generating class ...".  They can be written directly to the diagnostic
572     * writer, but that bypasses low-level checks about whether to suppress notes,
573     * and bypasses the diagnostic listener for API clients.
574     * Overall, it's an over-constrained problem with no obvious good solution.
575     *
576     * Note: there is an intentional difference in behavior between the diagnostic source
577     * being set to {@code null} (no source intended) and {@code NO_SOURCE} (no source available).
578     *
579     * @param dt      the diagnostic type
580     * @param ds      the diagnostic source
581     * @param dp      the diagnostic position
582     * @param message the message
583     */
584    private void report(DiagnosticType dt, Set<DiagnosticFlag> flags,
585            DiagnosticSource ds, DiagnosticPosition dp, String message) {
586        report(
587            javadocDiags.create(dt, null, flags, ds, dp, "message", message));
588    }
589
590    /**
591     * Returns a diagnostic position for a documentation tree node.
592     *
593     * @param path the path for the documentation tree node
594     * @return the diagnostic position
595     */
596    private DiagnosticPosition getDiagnosticPosition(DocTreePath path) {
597        DCDocComment dc = (DCDocComment) path.getDocComment();
598        DCTree dcTree = (DCTree) path.getLeaf();
599        return dcTree.pos(dc);
600    }
601
602    /**
603     * Returns a diagnostic position for an element, or {@code null} if the source
604     * file is not available.
605     *
606     * @param element the element
607     * @return the diagnostic position
608     */
609    private DiagnosticPosition getDiagnosticPosition(Element element) {
610        ToolEnvironment toolEnv = getToolEnv();
611        DocSourcePositions posns = getSourcePositions();
612        TreePath tp = toolEnv.elementToTreePath.get(element);
613        if (tp == null) {
614            return null;
615        }
616        CompilationUnitTree compUnit = tp.getCompilationUnit();
617        JCTree tree = (JCTree) tp.getLeaf();
618        int start = (int) posns.getStartPosition(compUnit, tree);
619        int pos = tree.getPreferredPosition();
620        int end = (int) posns.getEndPosition(compUnit, tree);
621        return createDiagnosticPosition(tree, start, pos, end);
622    }
623
624    /**
625     * Creates a diagnostic position.
626     *
627     * @param tree the tree node, or null if no tree is applicable
628     * @param start the start position
629     * @param pos   the "preferred" position: this is used to position the caret in messages
630     * @param end   the end position
631     * @return the diagnostic position
632     */
633    private DiagnosticPosition createDiagnosticPosition(JCTree tree, int start,
634            int pos, int end) {
635        return new DiagnosticPosition() {
636            @Override
637            public JCTree getTree() {
638                return tree;
639            }
640
641            @Override
642            public int getStartPosition() {
643                return start;
644            }
645
646            @Override
647            public int getPreferredPosition() {
648                return pos;
649            }
650
651            @Override
652            public int getEndPosition(EndPosTable endPosTable) {
653                return end;
654            }
655        };
656    }
657
658    /**
659     * Returns the diagnostic type for a diagnostic kind.
660     *
661     * @param kind the diagnostic kind
662     * @return the diagnostic type
663     */
664    private DiagnosticType getDiagnosticType(Diagnostic.Kind kind) {
665        return switch (kind) {
666        case ERROR -> DiagnosticType.ERROR;
667        case WARNING, MANDATORY_WARNING -> DiagnosticType.WARNING;
668        case NOTE -> DiagnosticType.NOTE;
669        case OTHER -> DiagnosticType.FRAGMENT;
670        };
671    }
672
673    /**
674     * Returns the diagnostic flags for a diagnostic kind.
675     * A diagnostic kind of {@code MANDATORY_WARNING} requires the {@code MANDATORY} flag.
676     *
677     * @param kind the diagnostic kind
678     * @return the flags
679     */
680    private Set<DiagnosticFlag> getDiagnosticFlags(Diagnostic.Kind kind) {
681        return kind == Kind.MANDATORY_WARNING
682            ? EnumSet.of(DiagnosticFlag.MANDATORY)
683            : EnumSet.noneOf(DiagnosticFlag.class);
684    }
685
686    /**
687     * Returns the diagnostic source for a documentation tree node.
688     *
689     * @param path the path for the documentation tree node
690     * @return the diagnostic source
691     */
692    private DiagnosticSource getDiagnosticSource(DocTreePath path) {
693        return getDiagnosticSource(
694            path.getTreePath().getCompilationUnit().getSourceFile());
695    }
696
697    /**
698     * Returns the diagnostic source for an element, or {@code NO_SOURCE} if the
699     * source file is not known (for example, if the element was read from a class file).
700     *
701     * @param element the element
702     * @return the diagnostic source
703     */
704    private DiagnosticSource getDiagnosticSource(Element element) {
705        TreePath tp = getToolEnv().elementToTreePath.get(element);
706        return tp == null ? DiagnosticSource.NO_SOURCE
707            : getDiagnosticSource(tp.getCompilationUnit().getSourceFile());
708    }
709
710    /**
711     * Returns the diagnostic source for a file object.
712     *
713     * {@code DiagnosticSource} objects are moderately expensive because they maintain
714     * an internal copy of the content, to provide the line map.
715     * Therefore, we keep a small memory-sensitive cache of recently used objects.
716     *
717     * @param fo the file object
718     * @return the diagnostic source
719     */
720    private DiagnosticSource getDiagnosticSource(JavaFileObject fo) {
721        Reference<DiagnosticSource> ref = diagSourceCache.get(fo);
722        DiagnosticSource ds = ref == null ? null : ref.get();
723        if (ds == null) {
724            ds = new DiagnosticSource(fo, this);
725            diagSourceCache.put(fo, new SoftReference<>(ds));
726        }
727        return ds;
728    }
729
730    /**
731     * Returns the object for computing source positions.
732     *
733     * The value is determined lazily because the tool environment is computed lazily.
734     *
735     * @return the object for computing source positions
736     */
737    private DocSourcePositions getSourcePositions() {
738        if (sourcePositions == null) {
739            sourcePositions = getToolEnv().docTrees.getSourcePositions();
740        }
741        return sourcePositions;
742    }
743
744    /**
745     * Returns the tool environment.
746     *
747     * The value is determined lazily, because creating it eagerly disrupts
748     * the overall initialization of objects in the context.
749     *
750     * @return the tool environment
751     */
752    private ToolEnvironment getToolEnv() {
753        if (toolEnv == null) {
754            toolEnv = ToolEnvironment.instance(context);
755        }
756        return toolEnv;
757    }
758}
